# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width = 10)
    words = split(str)
    lines = []
    for word in words
        if length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, word)
        elseif !isempty(lines) && length(lines[end]) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, "")
        end
        if !isempty(lines)
            lines[end] *= word
        end
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```
Example usage:
```julia
str = "This is a long string that needs to be wrapped"
wrapped_str = wrap_string(str)
println(wrapped_str)
```
Output:
```
This is a long
string that needs
to be wrapped
```
